# formattingContext

**Instance Property**

A description of where the formatted string will appear, allowing the formatter to capitalize the output appropriately.

## Declaration

```swift
var formattingContext: Formatter.Context { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Formatter/Context/unknown]. For additional details about specifying contexts, see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Formatter/Context].

## Configuring Formatter Options

- **calendar**: The calendar to use for formatting values that don’t have an inherent calendar of their own.
- **locale**: The locale to use when formatting the date.
- **dateTimeStyle**: The style to use when describing a relative date, for example “yesterday” or “1 day ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.DateTimeStyle**: A type that represents the style to use when formatting relative dates, such as “1 week ago” or “last week”.
- **unitsStyle**: The style to use when formatting the quantity or the name of the unit, such as “1 day ago” or “one day ago”.
- **RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle**: A type that represents the style to use when formatting the units of relative dates.
